beer.beer_description: Meantime London Stout is derived from the original Stout Porters of the early 19th century. Made without the roast barley used in their Irish descendents; dark malts and London water work closely together to give a beer of great complexity. Soft mocha coffee and vanilla notes on the nose hint at the lingering vanilla notes on the tongue. A velvet mouthfeel holds a rich and complex palate of caramel, molasses, and nut roast, which gives way to a gentle malt-bitter dryness.

items.badge_description: Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 345 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 70!

Porters and Stouts are rich with both history and flavor. Roasty, dark, and delicious, these two styles helped start it all. That‚Äôs 180 different beers with the style of Porter or Stout. Try 5 more for Level 37!

items.checkin_comment: I mean, this is a classic stout style. More porter in today's terms, but that's the point isn't it? It's sleek and soft coffee vibes, but there's not a dollop of modern thick impy vibes. This is light, quaffable and tasty for the winter months.

items.badge_name: Beyond a Shadow of a Stout (Level 94)
items.badge_description: We all love Stouts, and now we have a dedicated badge to celebrate your dedication to these dark, top-fermented beer in multiple variations, like Oatmeal, Milk and more! Which one will you start with? That's 470 different beers with the style of Stout. Try 5 more for Level 95!

user.bio: Works at Beershoppen Kolding. Beer lover with a hoppy Heart and a dark stout soul. Allways up for a trade.

items.checkin_comment: Back to the old scrapbook to log sipping from a few years back.  This one was drunk on 13/10/2011. I really liked it.

items.badge_description: Round round get around, you get around. Get around round round you get around. Ooh-ooh! That‚Äôs 5 different beers from 5 different countries in a row.

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 140 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 29!
